subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Are radio waves necessary?
author: SnowfireL@aol.com
full_text:
--part1_7ad59.7aaa4eff.396b28ff_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Language: en

There are stations Frank, it's that I'm trying to let people know, that the=
 
 voices coming through are not radio people, because when the RS is 
spin=
ning or  scanning, it goes so fast, radio broadcasts don't come through 
an=
ymore, the  reception I get here when it's scanning, is only spirit voice n=
ow.  
I've  noticed your radio's don't have as much plain static coming thr=
ough, so 
there  must be something better about yours and those mini's than=
 what 
sound i get with  RS.  btw, I sent out that picture small, how in th=
e world did 
it get so  large?  Sorry, about that, sf
 
 
In a message date=
d 7/11/2010 2:54:22 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
purplealiengirl@...=
 writes:

 
 
 
What ya do is drive into a big a city with lots of radio st=
ations,  record 
a few tapes, then go home and listen. "They" would know wh=
at you're  doing, 
and make messages accordingly. 
I doubt one my boxes wou=
ld any  better than anythign else with no stations.
 
 F-S
 


On Sat, Jul =
10, 2010 at 10:55 AM, <_SnowfireL@..._ 
(mailto:SnowfireL@...) >  w=
rote:


 
 
 


Since i live rural, i wonder if my property being next  to =
a small private 
lake, and across the road about 1/4 mile is the tower for =
 Altel now Verison 
on the north west side, and same distance on the other =
 side is ATT, they 
are south east of me, then down further is another ATT =
 tower, and plus my 
big antennae on the roof, i wonder if that's help them=
  come through on my FM 
RS 20-125 radio's, I don't even hear radio signal =
on  them anymore, even on 
the FM channel, it's weird, and can't get any AM=
's  either, AM's only give 
me this funny ringing noise, but the FM gives m=
e  static or them talking, I 
sure wish i could buy one of those fancy boxe=
s  Franks has bet I'd be a 
boomin over here!  hint hint.,  sf



 


-----=
Original Message-----
From: Zack Widup <_w9sz.zack@gmail.w9s_ (mailto:w9sz.=
zack@...) >
To: _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
.com) 
Sent: Sat, Jul 10, 2010  10:11 am
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Are radio w=
aves necessary?


 
 
 
 

My take on it is that the spirits or whatever th=
ey are are capable  of 
using whatever methods are placed in front of them.=
 DVR's get EVP. I've  gotten 
EVP on the sound tracks of a video recorder. =
The radio and ITC seems  to 
generate a different class of communication. E=
VP-Maker is another  one.
 
Probably the method of actually producing the s=
ound waves is  different for 
each device.
 
Zack


On Sat, Jul 10, 2010 at=
 8:20 AM, John S <_phenom_investigatorphenom_inv_ 
(mailto:phenom_investiga=
tor@...) > wrote:


 
 
 

 
Raymond Bayless was getting recorded spi=
rit voices back in the  1950's.
While his best known work was with von Sala=
zy on audio tape,  Bayless
also received voices using an early grammophone-=
also received voices using 
an e
In other words, he was using strictly a me=
chanical recorder. This  would
suggest that the voices may not require elec=
tronics at all. And that  would
imply that radio signals may have nothing t=
o do with the voice  reception.
 
Consider too that EVPMAKER sessions seem =
to work well for some  people.
Except for the mechnical recordings, which a=
re few in number, all  the
current techniques have electronics in common. S=
o it would make  sense
that electronics might be important to the process. =
However,  when 
you factor in the mechanical recordings made using devices =
prior to  
modern electronics, it seems more sensible to look for a common =

explanation which involves environmental manipulation. The most  reasonabl=
e
thing we know of that meets this criterion is mind-matter  interaction,
o=
r psychokinesis (PK).
 
The only remaining question then, aside from the ac=
tual source of the  
information which cannot be objectively ascertained as=
 of yet, is  whether
a single or multiple mechanisms are indeed at work. Ev=
en though radio  
waves 
are not required to produce the phenomena, if mult=
iple mechanisms are  at 
work, 
it may be that radio waves are one of many =
ways the phenomena is  produced.
 
Bottom line, with so many options much m=
ore information is needed to  form 
any
reasonable hypothesis.
 
 
 
 




=




























--part1_7ad59.7aaa4eff.396b28ff_boundary
